H0.text: who was it that described the structure of dna. Rosalind Franklin

H1.text: who was it that described the structure of dna. Francis Crick

H2.text: who was it that described the structure of dna. Linus Pauling

H3.text: who was it that described the structure of dna. James Watson

A4.text: The X-ray diffraction images collected by Gosling and Franklin provided the best evidence for the helical nature of DNA.

A5.text: Before this, both Linus Pauling, Watson, and Crick had generated erroneous models with the chains inside and the bases pointing outwards.
